featured.text: As digital reading is changing our traditional way of reading, book towns like Hay-on-Wye are particularly important to 15 .
For example, an annual book festival is held in Hay-on-Wye.
Since the 1970s, book towns like Hay- on-Wye 12 up all over the world.
The concept was 11 by Richard Booth, who opened the first second-hand bookshop in Hay-on-Wye, UK in 1961.

definition.zh_def: 一種形狀像字母Y的結構，通常用於鐵路或管道的分岔。
definition.en_def: A structure shaped like the letter Y, commonly used for branching in railways or pipelines.
definition.example: The train switched tracks at the wye to head in the opposite direction.
